text: Bottle. Dark brown color. Caramel, oak and a hint of roast in the aroma. Malty sweet oaky roasty flavor. caramel. Bitter nuts. Decent, tasty. Well controlled oak aging.

Bottle split at L42, thanks to Kenny for this Top 50 treat, 14/03/17.
Murky amber with a moderately appointed off white cap that escapes edgeward.
Nose is sweet and sour, fruit rinds, caramel, strawberry essence, light barrel notes.
Taste comprises mellow dark fruit shreds, toffee, tarte orange, peppery spice, fruit loaf.
Full bodied, fine carbonation, drying close with a boosty kick.
Fine for the style but doesnt deliver on an 8%+ billing compared to other beers.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: March 2017 - Bottle share at One Canada Square. Big thanks to Ken. As Ramses Bier IJsbeer met Hout, a "Scottish Ale" according to Ratebeer. Hazy light brown, opaque, foamy light brown head leaves full lacing. Aroma is toffee, a little buttery, caramel and red apple. Body is smooth with soft carbonation. Taste is twiggy, spicy, some tangy apple, woody dry finish with some haggis and bagpipe notes. Quite decent actually. (3.3)

14th March 201742nd Floor Bottleshare. Hazy deep amber beer, good pale tan head. Airy palate, fairly dry and with modest fine carbonation. Tangy fluffy malts, modest dark chocolate. Some bitterish whiskey in the background. Modest orange peel and mild spice. Little malt cream. Dry and slightly bitter woody finish. Not bad.

Bottle shared in London - cheers! Pours hazy brown with a creamy, off-white head. The nose has aged caramel, toasted bread, old orange. Medium sweet flavour with some oxidation, minerals, old wood, aged dates. Medium bodied with fine carbonation. Finishes with a little warmth, flinty minerals, aged caramel. Just ok.

Bottle shared on Level 42 14/03/2017. Many thanks to Kenny for this one. A hazed reddy amber coloured pour with a lasting beige head. Aroma is jammy fruits, butterscotch, toffee, apple cake, . Flavour is composed of semi sweet tangy jammy fruits, nutty, toffee, brown sugars, frothy. Lingering tangy green apple. Palate is semi sweet, frothy, grainy. Good.

Bottle care of Kenny. It pour some murky brown with a medium yellow - beige head. The aroma is sweet, sugary, tangy, toasty sugars, vanilla, Scottish tablet, toffee, red berry and butterscotch. The taste is dry, bitter, tangy, sourish, wood, red berry, berry skin, vanilla, whisky, leather, smoked action and some alcohol with a dry, woody finish. Medium body and fine carbonation. Not bad, wouldnt chug much though.

Bottle share at Level 42. Thanks to Kenny for this one. Pours hazy brown with off white head. Aroma is toffee, caramel with a hint of whisky. Taste is tablet, fudge with a smooth whisky taste that has a decent balance. Nice for the style

0,33l bottle at home bought from Beer Navigator. As "Ramses Bier Ijsbeer Whisky Hout" 9% ABV. Brewnumber 20141010. brown color, small tan head. smells of dark fruits, raisins, nutty, marzipan, light honey, flowery, light off-notes. decent but rather subtle smell. full body, light carbonation, soft mouthfeel. tastes lightly acidic, earthy, caramel, honey, marzipan, spices, very very light wood, hints of whisky. finishes lightly bitter with notes of hints of whisky, spices and caramel. good one, rather unique, quite subtle, whisky notes are very soft too. alcohol very subtle too. good beer overall.

750ml bottle (thans martjoobolut). Hazy red color. Tiny size, white head, disappears. Fruity, sweet, yeast, plastic, blooming flowers in aroma. Malty, alcohol, nice and woody, whiskey in taste. Whiskey and twiggy in aftertaste. Nice, but nobody even havent tried ti hide alcohol.

750ml bottle - thanks martjoobolut
Nice fresh hoppy aroma, good crispness, very plain, but too sweet. Malty, but harsh as such.

Bottle, batch 20141010 (from hietbiermoment). Pours red amber with beige head. The head stays for a moment. Aroma is sweet, malt, fruits, citrus, mango and pineapple. Flavor is sweet and bitter, citrus, lemon, grapefruit, malt, woodiness, dryness. Finish is dry and fruity. Overall: very good.

33cl bottle, 9.0 abv. Pours almost clear dark reddish brown colour with a huge most good lasting beige head. Aroma of strong dark malt, caramel, vanilla, some wood, mild sweetness. Taste of roasted malt, some coffee, wood, a touch of peated malt, vanilla, good!

Bottle 330ml. [ As Ramses Bier IJsbeer Whiskey Hout ].ABV: 9.0%. Clear medium to dark red brown color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, chocolate, dark malt, light roasted. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a long duration, candy, chocolate, sweet malt. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20150812]
Pint Oak Aged Beer Festival 2015 @ Stadsbrouwerij De Pelgrim, Rotterdam. Lekker hoppig. Backlog from 2015/03/15.

sample from bottle, poured a hazy amber colour with a tanned head. nose has toasted malts, caramal, raisins, licorice, bitter orange peel, wood, and herbs. taste is sweet, with a small vanilla notice. ok

33 cl bottle. Pours cloudy orange to amber with a small tan head. Aroma is light phenolic and toasted malty. Bitter and slight herbal. Smooth fruity. Toasted malty. Bitter and slight herbal into the finish.

Bottle sampled at Chris and Ruths place in London. Clear copper/Amber beer with a decent beige head. Malty caramel aroma, woody, whisky, figs, plastic notes. Fruity flavor, citrus, grasserande, hay, floran notes? Strabge scottish Ale.

Bottle at oak aged festival. Dark brown with small off white head. Big fruity hops with orange, mango, then lots of spices, herbs and flowers. Light sweet and medium to strong bitter finish. Medium bodied. Nice!

At Gouda Winterfest 2015. Poured clear reddish brown with a small off white head. Aroma of roast malt, light whiskey, liquorice, Medium to full body, flavour is lightly sweet, moderately bitter, quite astringent, the liquorice is quite subdued.Earlier Rating: 1/26/2014 Total Score: 3.3At Gouda 2014. Poured clear reddish amber with a medium white head. Huge wood on the nose, sweet malt and fruit underneath. Medium body, more wood overpowering. Flavour is medium bitter-sweet.
Aroma of dark malt, caramel, lots of wood, spicy notes, some liquorice. Flavour is moderate sweet with a nice moderate to medium bittersweet finish. Nice one, definitely a step up from the base beer.
@ Nijmeegse winter bierfeesten. Taste is wood and more wood, citrus. Bitter afthertaste.To mutch wood taste.

330ml bottle Apperance: Clear very dark reddish with a , small beige head. Aroma: grassy/ vegetable with some caramlised malts. Taste: Moderate sweet, caramalised malts, light vegetables and quite some licorice wood. Medium body,average carbonation.

Interesting the use of licorice wood. Instead of the standard ways of wood.
Heldere koperen kleur met een aardige kraag. Ruikt gerookt, vanille en hout. Smaakt lekker zoetigs en vanille iets bitter in de afdronk.
Pours a reddish brown beer with a good white head. Smells hops, dust and malts. Tastes hops, licorice with a good bitter finish. Average carbo, medium body and a sticky texture.

Bottle at the Gouda Winterbier fest, 2014. Poured a clear medium amber with a thin white head. The aroma is malt citrus fruit with some alcohol and resin. The flavour is medium to strong bitter with a nettle hop malt woody resin palate. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Really liked this. Theres lots going on!

Sample from bottle at Winterbier Festival Gouda 2014. Pours hazy orange/amber with a medium off-white head. Aroma is sweet with some wood and spices. Taste is also sweet with some spices and an over medium bitter finish, bit dry. Medium body and carbo.

@PWBF14 te Gouda,kleine proefglaasje gedeeld, kastanjebruin met lichte witte kraag. In de aroma komt het hout als eerste terug, daarna de caramouten en nog een mout waarschijnlijk amber. In de smaak komt ook weer de houttoetsen als eerste naar boven, toch wel redelijk bitter, nog iets wat ik niet meer kan lezen uit mijn notities ;), afdronk iig bitter, als slotopmerkingen de aantekening : nat bos ervaring

Licht troebel, hazelnootkleurig bruin met cremekleurige kraag. Aroma is licht zurig, wat volgens mij niet helemaal de bedoeling kan zijn, en wat hout. Smaak is meer hout en minder zuur. Verder wat rook. Vrij droog bier, licht bitter. Prettig mondgevoel.
Sampled @ PWBF Gouda 2014. Clear dark reddish to slightly brownish color, small beige head. Smell and taste malts, bitter, lightly vegetables. Medium body and carbonation.

Bottle, Gouda Winterbier Fest. Clear copper pour, straw head. Grassy/vegetal, peppery aroma, super herbal, light toasted malt. Taste is bitter, grassy/vegetal, light caramel sweetness, belgian yeast, sweet. OK.

Bottle sampled at Gouda Winterbier Festival. Clear orange brown pour with a small tan head. Aroma of fruits, wood, cask. Flavour is moderate sweet and moderate to heavy bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle sample at PWBF14. Brown colour, off white head. Aroma of plastic, cabbage, wood, earth, malts. Flavour is quite nice, light earthy, wood, malty, a bit floral, caramel, light spicy cedar wood, some vanilla. Medium-bodied at best.
